alert.note: Alert for Augusta; Rockingham (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 25 at 10:15AM EST until February 25 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. A coating of snow and sleet. A light glaze of ice from freezing rain is expected along the ridges above 2,000 feet. * WHERE...Augusta and Rockingham Counties. * WHEN...Until 4 PM EST today. A mixture of light snow, sleet, and rain is expected. Precipitation will end between 1 PM and 4 PM this afternoon. The rain is expected to freeze on elevated surfaces, mainly along the ridges above 2,000 feet. * IMPACTS...Very slippery sidewalks, roads and bridges are possible.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
